name: Cranberry-Orange Relish
description: This sweet and tart cranberry relish is much more refreshing than cooked cranberry sauce, and it takes about as long to make as it does to open a can. You'll need a food processor for this one; a blender will reduce everything to juice. Leftovers are great for breakfast with plain yogurt.
recipeCategory: easy, quick, condiments, dips and spreads
keywords: cranberry, orange, dairy-free, gluten-free, halal, healthy, kosher, low cholesterol, low-sodium, vegetarian, fall, winter, side dish
recipeIngredient: 1 whole navel orange, skin included, washed and cut into chunks
1/3 cup mild honey, such as clover

recipeInstructions.text: Place all the ingredients in a food processor and pulse, then blend until you have a uniform, very finely chopped mixture with a crunchy texture. Chill until ready to serve.
